intro: Stachys hintoniorum, commonly known as Hinton's hedge nettle, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Stachys hintoniorum is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
